text: <@U25C65C3S> I’ve sent a DM to Matt, will update here when he answer :slightly_smiling_face:
Working on a fix to build the `url` parameter correctly

Is there anyway to associate a js file with a global group? I have js that goes along with a mega menu which is part of the global header group. I'd rather not have it all inline but there doesn't seem to be a way to have it be included without going through every existing page template and adding it that way. Am i wrong or is this the only solution?

<@UGCPXTKMW>, so we did this on each page template for our mega menu unfortunately, however, I was thinking about this as well, in the Global Group, couldn’t you have a new module with a reference to the the JS file in the Design Manager, I know I answered your question with a question but maybe it will start spinning some things from others to comment
That's not a bad idea, it would definitely be less time consuming than going through all our templates

Also i guess if i wanted it in the footer i could create the file in design manager and just put the link inside the site footer HTML that goes across all pages. I think i'd have to minify it myself when i do that, i think only linked files get that treatment
Fix should be out if you want to check again
Should just be able to use the `url` variable and it will append the URL parameter

Having an issue trying to display different modules in a global header with the following code. It seems to be only executing on the very first variable and ignoring the other "is not" paths. I've also tried using separate elif statements instead and it also only works for the first statement. Is this a bug or is there something not right?
sorry - not sure the answer to your question, just wanted to say, I now want the title of “audiologist” because of your post

Found something weird. When a module is set to all templates types [Page, Blog, Email]. Color fields are missing the opacity selector. Feature? or a bug? Right now it's causing me a lot of issues. Not sure who would be the right to ask about this?
